trans-unit.source: DATE provides for storage of a year-month-day in the range supported by java.sql.Date.

seg-source.mrk: DATE provides for storage of a year-month-day in the range supported by java.sql.Date.

target.mrk: DATE provides for storage of a year-month-day in the range supported by java.sql.Date.

trans-unit.source: Dates, times, and timestamps must not be mixed with one another in expressions.

seg-source.mrk: Dates, times, and timestamps must not be mixed with one another in expressions.

target.mrk: Dates, times, and timestamps must not be mixed with one another in expressions.

trans-unit.source: Any value that is recognized by the java.sql.Date method is permitted in a column of the corresponding SQL date/time data type. supports the following formats for DATE:

seg-source.mrk: Any value that is recognized by the java.sql.Date method is permitted in a column of the corresponding SQL date/time data type.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the following formats for DATE:

target.mrk: Any value that is recognized by the java.sql.Date method is permitted in a column of the corresponding SQL date/time data type.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the following formats for DATE:

trans-unit.source: The first of the three formats above is the java.sql.Date format.

seg-source.mrk: The first of the three formats above is the java.sql.Date format.

target.mrk: The first of the three formats above is the java.sql.Date format.

trans-unit.source: The year must always be expressed with four digits, while months and days may have either one or two digits.

seg-source.mrk: The year must always be expressed with four digits, while months and days may have either one or two digits.

target.mrk: The year must always be expressed with four digits, while months and days may have either one or two digits.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server. If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server.
If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server.
If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.
